item.title: CULINARYON has opened a cooking studio in Singapore for classes and parties
item.description:
A workstation equipped with eggs and two varieties of flour, ready for preparing homemade tagliatelle. CULINARYON, the largest culinary edutainment studio in Europe, established in Moscow in 2012, has expanded to Singapore. Their 7,000 square foot studio at One Raffles Place, inaugurated in October 2015, is their second location and holds the title of the biggest cooking studio in Asia. The CULINARYON studio has a capacity of 200 people and can be reconfigured into a conference room and four distinct event spaces...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/culinaryon-has-opened-a-cooking-studio-in-singapore-for-classes-and-parties/

item.title: CruCycle brings a fresh perspective to the fitness scene in Singapore
item.description:
Krewfit recently introduced CruCycle, a new spin studio concept in Singapore, to fitness and fun enthusiasts. The studio’s classes operate on the principle of “Riding with the Pack,” emphasizing group workouts, teamwork, and camaraderie. This makes CruCycle’s workouts perfect for corporate team-building events. Source: Crucycle. The Ding siblings – Valerie, Calvin, and Beatrice – founded, own, and operate CruCycle. The inspiration for the studio came from their upbringing in Los Angeles, California...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/crucycle-brings-a-fresh-perspective-to-the-fitness-scene-in-singapore/
